subject: Self Care
title: Identity-Based Habits
description: A quick, practical guide to Identity-Based Habits.

hook.text: 'I'm trying to quit smoking' fails. 'I'm not a smoker' succeeds. The identity shift makes the difference.

buildup.text: Most people set goals. James Clear argues you should set identities. Become the person who does the thing.

discovery.text: Every action is a vote for the identity you want. Each workout says 'I'm someone who exercises regularly.'

twist.text: You don't need perfect consistency. You need enough votes. A majority, not unanimity, builds identity.

climax.text: Decide who you want to be. Then prove it to yourself with small, consistent actions day after day.

punchline.text: Change the identity. The habits follow naturally.

quiz.question: What is an identity-based habit?
options: A habit based on a goal
Becoming the type of person who naturally does the behavior
A habit assigned by someone else
